deity_category: Outer Gods and Great Old Ones
edict: Sow discord among allies, misuse positions of authority by steering events toward apocalyptic ends
markdown:
<title level="1" right="Deity " pfs="Restricted">[Nyarlathotep (The Crawling Chaos)](/Deities.aspx?ID=573)</title>

<row gap="medium">
<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

<traits>

</traits>

**Source** [Divine Mysteries](/Sources.aspx?ID=234) pg. 318

Nyarlathotep is a being of a thousand shapes, each of which has a name, such as the [Haunter of the Dark](/Deities.aspx?ID=222) or the [Veiled Voice](/Deities.aspx?ID=575). Because he has walked the world in mortal form, Nyarlathotep is unique among the Outer Gods for appearing comprehensible and understandable—but this is a facade. The Crawling Chaos, as he is also known, appears humanlike not because he identifies with mortal concerns or cares for his mortal followers, but because a mortal shape makes it easier for him to do his work: spreading the influence of the Outer Gods.

In his role as a herald, messenger, and agent provocateur for the Outer Gods, Nyarlathotep is the Outer God most likely to have direct interactions with mortals. He answers prayers, teaches evil magic, and inserts himself into history—all to enable mortal cruelty, facilitate the release of Great Old Ones, and turn whole societies toward worship of the Outer Gods. He was instrumental in the fall of Ancient Osirion, and some believe he led Taldor to launch the Armies of Exploration, a glorious folly that proved the ruin of that empire. There are countless tales of his interaction with (and often possession of) mortal cultists and magicians who dare to call upon him, and they all end in grotesque corruption and death. Nyarlathotep also lingers among [Azathoth’s](/Deities.aspx?ID=161) court, carrying out schemes under the guise of the Primal Chaos’s will.

<column gap="tiny">

**Category** [Outer Gods and Great Old Ones](/DeityCategories.aspx?ID=13)

**Edicts** Sow discord among allies, misuse positions of authority by steering events toward apocalyptic ends

**Anathema** None

**Area of Concern**
Conspiracies, dangerous secrets, forbidden magic

</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>
<title level="2">Devotee Benefits</title>

<column gap="tiny">

**[Divine Attribute](/Backgrounds.aspx?ID=132)**
Dexterity or Intelligence

**Divine Font** [Harm](/Spells.aspx?ID=146)

**Divine Sanctification** none

**Divine Skill** [Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=35)

**Favored Weapon** [Staff](/Weapons.aspx?ID=367)

**Domains** [Knowledge](/Domains.aspx?ID=80), [Magic](/Domains.aspx?ID=82), [Nightmares](/Domains.aspx?ID=86), [Trickery](/Domains.aspx?ID=94)

**[Alternate Domains](/Rules.aspx?ID=802)** 

**Cleric Spells**

- **1st**
[Message Rune](/Spells.aspx?ID=2356)

- **2nd**
[Humanoid Form](/Spells.aspx?ID=1560)

- **3rd**
[Enthrall](/Spells.aspx?ID=1516)

- **4th**
[Suggestion](/Spells.aspx?ID=1693)

- **5th**
[Summon Entity](/Spells.aspx?ID=1699)

- **6th**
[Mislead](/Spells.aspx?ID=1605)

- **7th**
[Project Image](/Spells.aspx?ID=1640)

- **8th**
[Dream Council](/Spells.aspx?ID=1988)

- **9th**
[Phantasmagoria](/Spells.aspx?ID=1629)

</column>
